translation.title: On the Bank of the Sutanu

segments.en: 3. On the Bank of the Sutanu

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā anuruddho sāvatthiyaṃ viharati sutanutīre.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī on the bank of the Sutanu.

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yenāyasmā anuruddho tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā anuruddhena saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
segments.en: Then several mendicants went up to Venerable Anuruddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “katamesaṃ āyasmā anuruddho dhammānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā mahābhiññataṃ patto”ti?
segments.en: “What things has Venerable Anuruddha developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”

segments.pli: “Catunnaṃ khvāhaṃ, āvuso, satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā mahābhiññataṃ patto.
segments.en: “Reverends, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, kāye kāyānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: I meditate observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
I meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ—
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: imesaṃ khvāhaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā mahābhiññataṃ patto.
segments.en: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Imesañca panāhaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā hīnaṃ dhammaṃ hīnato abbhaññāsiṃ, majjhimaṃ dhammaṃ majjhimato abbhaññāsiṃ, paṇītaṃ dhammaṃ paṇītato abbhaññāsin”ti.
segments.en: And it was by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly knew the lower realm as lower, the middle realm as middle, and the higher realm as higher.”

sections.title: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: When some mendicants ask Anuruddha how he attained such higher knowledge, he replies it is from developing the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
